Name: Gaussian/Normal
Unbounded_Assumptions: Infinite tails P(x>any)>0; continuous σ∈ℝ; unbounded support
Current_Usage: Measurement error; thermal noise; CLT applications
Bounded_Alternative: Truncated Gaussian G[μ σ a b] with hard cutoffs at S_observable boundary
Evidence: PATH_20: Gaussian noise 3.70% compressible

Name: Poisson
Unbounded_Assumptions: Continuous rate λ∈(0 ∞); unbounded event count k∈ℕ; continuous time assumption
Current_Usage: Rare events; radioactive decay; photon emission
Bounded_Alternative: Discrete rate parameter; k_max ≤ √(2n) from Nittay bound; quantized time
Evidence: Physical processes bounded - Planck time sets minimum

Name: Exponential
Unbounded_Assumptions: Infinite tail P(T>t)>0 for all t; memoryless property; unbounded waiting time
Current_Usage: Waiting times; decay rates; queuing theory
Bounded_Alternative: Geometric distribution (discrete); truncated at T_max = universe age; bounded state transitions
Evidence: Physical waiting times finite - universe age bounds all processes

Name: Power Law
Unbounded_Assumptions: Unbounded support x∈[x_min ∞); infinite variance for α≤2; scale-free assumption
Current_Usage: Social networks; earthquakes; wealth distribution; galaxy rotation
Bounded_Alternative: Power law with S_observable cutoff at r_obs = c×n_steps; characteristic scale exists
Evidence: Redshift artifact shows apparent scale-free is S_observable boundary

Name: Uniform (unbounded)
Unbounded_Assumptions: Infinite support U(-∞ ∞); infinite entropy; equal probability over ℝ
Current_Usage: Never physically occurs - mathematical construct only
Bounded_Alternative: Impossible - violates information theory; replace with bounded U[a b]
Evidence: Infinite entropy violates Two Randomness - never observed

Name: Uniform (bounded)
Unbounded_Assumptions: None - naturally bounded U[a b]
Current_Usage: Maximum entropy for bounded support; uncertainty within S_observable
Bounded_Alternative: Already bounded - no fix needed
Evidence: Maximum entropy distribution for known bounds

Name: Binomial
Unbounded_Assumptions: None - k∈{0...n} naturally bounded
Current_Usage: SAT assignments; coin flips; independent bounded trials
Bounded_Alternative: Already bounded - no fix needed
Evidence: n trials = physical constraint; O(n^c) outcomes match S_observable

Name: Multinomial
Unbounded_Assumptions: None - outcomes ∈ {1...k} bounded
Current_Usage: Multi-class classification; dice rolls; categorical data
Bounded_Alternative: Already bounded - no fix needed
Evidence: Finite categories match S_observable constraints

Name: Geometric
Unbounded_Assumptions: Theoretically unbounded k∈ℕ but practically bounded
Current_Usage: Discrete waiting times; number of trials until success
Bounded_Alternative: Already discrete - apply k_max bound from S_observable
Evidence: Discrete analog of exponential - naturally closer to physical reality

Name: Hypergeometric
Unbounded_Assumptions: None - sampling without replacement naturally bounded
Current_Usage: Sampling; lottery; urn models
Bounded_Alternative: Already bounded - no fix needed
Evidence: Finite population = bounded; perfect for S_observable sampling

Name: Born Rule (continuous ℋ)
Unbounded_Assumptions: Infinite dimensional Hilbert space dim(ℋ)=∞; unbounded spectrum σ(Â)=ℝ; exponential superpositions
Current_Usage: Quantum measurement; Copenhagen interpretation
Bounded_Alternative: Discrete Hilbert space dim(ℋ_d)=O(n²); bounded spectrum λ∈[-M M]; polynomial superpositions only
Evidence: verify_discrete_hilbert.rs: outcomes 2.0% compressible

Name: Born Rule (discrete ℋ_d)
Unbounded_Assumptions: None - dim(ℋ_d)=O(n²) bounded; finite spectrum
Current_Usage: Quantum measurement with discrete basis projection
Bounded_Alternative: Already corrected via Discrete Hilbert Space
Evidence: Measurement outcomes 2% compressible - within physics-level range

Name: Boltzmann
Unbounded_Assumptions: Unbounded energy E∈[0 ∞); continuous temperature T∈(0 ∞); allows T→0 and T→∞
Current_Usage: Statistical mechanics; thermal equilibrium; partition functions
Bounded_Alternative: Discrete energy levels E∈{E_min...E_max}; T_min and T_max bounds; finite partition function
Evidence: Planck quantization sets energy discrete; no continuous spectrum

Name: Maxwell-Boltzmann
Unbounded_Assumptions: Unbounded velocity v∈ℝ³; continuous energy; infinite tail
Current_Usage: Velocity distribution of gas particles
Bounded_Alternative: Discrete velocity states; v_max from relativistic limit c; bounded kinetic energy
Evidence: Relativity bounds velocity; quantization bounds energy

Name: Fermi-Dirac
Unbounded_Assumptions: Continuous energy spectrum; unbounded chemical potential μ; T→0 allows
Current_Usage: Fermion occupation (electrons); quantum statistics
Bounded_Alternative: Discrete energy eigenstates; bounded μ∈[E_min E_max]; finite occupation numbers
Evidence: Physical systems have finite particle counts and bounded energy levels

Name: Bose-Einstein
Unbounded_Assumptions: Continuous energy spectrum; unbounded occupation n→∞; diverges at T→0
Current_Usage: Boson occupation (photons); quantum statistics
Bounded_Alternative: Discrete energy levels; bounded occupation n≤N_max from S_observable
Evidence: Physical systems constrained to S_observable particle states

Name: Chi-Squared (χ²)
Unbounded_Assumptions: Unbounded df; infinite tail; assumes Gaussian parent
Current_Usage: Hypothesis testing; goodness-of-fit; variance testing
Bounded_Alternative: Test against bounded alternatives; use compression ratio 15-92% as test
Evidence: Standard tests compare vs unbounded nulls - framework replaces

Name: Student's t
Unbounded_Assumptions: Infinite tails (heavier than Gaussian); unbounded df
Current_Usage: Hypothesis testing; small samples; confidence intervals
Bounded_Alternative: Test if sample is from S_observable (bounded) vs S_complete (unbounded)
Evidence: Tests assume continuous parent - use bounded compression test instead

Name: F-distribution
Unbounded_Assumptions: Ratio of χ² - inherits unbounded properties; infinite tail
Current_Usage: ANOVA; variance ratio tests
Bounded_Alternative: Compare bounded variances directly; avoid unbounded ratio distributions
Evidence: Derived from χ² - same unbounded assumptions

Name: Cauchy
Unbounded_Assumptions: Undefined mean/variance; infinite tails; unbounded support
Current_Usage: Resonance; Lorentzian line shapes; physics peaks
Bounded_Alternative: Truncated Cauchy with cutoffs; use for bounded resonances only
Evidence: Physical resonances have finite width - use bounded version

Name: Laplace (Double Exp)
Unbounded_Assumptions: Infinite tails both directions; unbounded support; continuous parameter
Current_Usage: Absolute differences; robust statistics; L1 optimization
Bounded_Alternative: Bounded Laplace or use bounded L1 with constraints
Evidence: Physical differences bounded by observable constraints

Name: Weibull
Unbounded_Assumptions: Shape parameter allows unbounded tails; scale parameter continuous
Current_Usage: Failure rates; lifetime modeling; reliability
Bounded_Alternative: Truncated Weibull with finite support; discrete scale parameter
Evidence: Physical lifetimes bounded by universe age and Planck time

Name: Gamma
Unbounded_Assumptions: Unbounded support [0 ∞); continuous shape/scale; infinite tail
Current_Usage: Waiting times (sum of exponentials); Bayesian priors
Bounded_Alternative: Truncated Gamma; discrete parameters; bounded support from S_observable
Evidence: Sum of exponentials inherits exponential's unbounded issues

Name: Beta
Unbounded_Assumptions: Bounded support [0 1] BUT continuous parameters α β
Current_Usage: Probabilities; proportions; Bayesian conjugate prior
Bounded_Alternative: Support bounded ✓; discretize α β parameters
Evidence: Bounded support good; parameters should be discrete

Name: Lognormal
Unbounded_Assumptions: Unbounded support (0 ∞); infinite tail; multiplicative processes
Current_Usage: Income; particle sizes; multiplicative growth
Bounded_Alternative: Truncated lognormal with upper bound from S_observable
Evidence: Multiplicative processes bounded by physical constraints

Name: Pareto
Unbounded_Assumptions: Power law tail; unbounded; infinite variance for α≤2; wealth inequality
Current_Usage: Wealth; city sizes; 80-20 rule
Bounded_Alternative: Pareto with S_observable cutoff; characteristic scale exists
Evidence: Same as power law #4 - apparent scale-free is artifact

Name: Zipf's Law
Unbounded_Assumptions: Power law P(k)∝1/k^α; theoretically unbounded rank k
Current_Usage: Word frequency; city rankings; web traffic
Bounded_Alternative: Zipf with cutoff at maximum observable rank N_max from S_observable
Evidence: Finite vocabulary/cities/pages - naturally bounded in practice

Name: Benford's Law
Unbounded_Assumptions: First digit distribution P(d=k); assumes scale-invariance
Current_Usage: First digits in financial/natural data; fraud detection
Bounded_Alternative: Digits 1-9 bounded ✓; but assumes infinite scale range (fix: finite data)
Evidence: Works because real data has bounded scales approximating scale-free

Name: Negative Binomial
Unbounded_Assumptions: Theoretically unbounded k; number of failures before r successes
Current_Usage: Overdispersed count data; infectious disease spread
Bounded_Alternative: Apply k_max bound; otherwise structurally sound
Evidence: Discrete and bounded in practice - close to physical

Name: Rayleigh
Unbounded_Assumptions: Unbounded support [0 ∞); magnitude of 2D Gaussian vector
Current_Usage: Signal magnitude; wind speed; wave heights
Bounded_Alternative: Truncated Rayleigh with physical maximum (e.g. c for speed)
Evidence: Derived from Gaussian - inherits unbounded tail issues

Name: Rician
Unbounded_Assumptions: Unbounded support [0 ∞); signal+noise magnitude
Current_Usage: Wireless communications; MRI; signal processing
Bounded_Alternative: Truncated Rician with bounded signal and noise power
Evidence: Physical signals have finite power - bound both signal and noise

Name: Gumbel (Extreme Value)
Unbounded_Assumptions: Unbounded support both directions (-∞ ∞); extreme value theory
Current_Usage: Maximum/minimum values; flood prediction; extreme events
Bounded_Alternative: Bounded extreme value distribution; max ≤ observable limit
Evidence: Extremes bounded by physical constraints (universe age energy limits)

Name: Wishart
Unbounded_Assumptions: Unbounded; continuous parameters; infinite dimensional limit
Current_Usage: Random matrices; covariance estimation; multivariate stats
Bounded_Alternative: Bounded matrix dimensions n×n with n≤N_max; discrete eigenvalues
Evidence: Physical systems have finite dimensions bounded by S_observable

Name: Dirichlet
Unbounded_Assumptions: Bounded support (simplex) BUT continuous concentration parameters
Current_Usage: Multinomial conjugate prior; topic modeling; compositional data
Bounded_Alternative: Support bounded ✓; discretize concentration parameters
Evidence: Simplex constraint bounds it; fix parameters to be discrete

Name: von Mises
Unbounded_Assumptions: Support bounded [0 2π) ✓; continuous concentration κ
Current_Usage: Circular data; angles; wind direction
Bounded_Alternative: Support naturally bounded ✓; discretize κ to integer precision
Evidence: Angles naturally bounded; concentration should be discrete

Name: Planck Distribution
Unbounded_Assumptions: ℏω continuous energy; assumes continuous spectrum; unbounded frequency
Current_Usage: Black body radiation; photon energy distribution
Bounded_Alternative: Discrete photon energies E=nℏω with n∈ℕ bounded; frequency quantized
Evidence: Planck's own quantization should make this discrete not continuous

Name: Wigner Semicircle
Unbounded_Assumptions: Eigenvalue distribution for infinite random matrices
Current_Usage: Random matrix theory; nuclear physics; quantum chaos
Bounded_Alternative: Finite N×N matrix eigenvalues with N bounded by S_observable
Evidence: Physical matrices have finite dimension - no infinite limit

Name: Tracy-Widom
Unbounded_Assumptions: Largest eigenvalue distribution; assumes infinite matrix limit
Current_Usage: Random matrix extreme statistics; wireless MIMO
Bounded_Alternative: Bounded matrix size; largest eigenvalue ≤ λ_max from finite N
Evidence: Largest eigenvalue bounded by matrix dimension and Nittay limit

Name: Marchenko-Pastur
Unbounded_Assumptions: Eigenvalue distribution for infinite rectangular matrices
Current_Usage: Random matrix theory; PCA; factor analysis
Bounded_Alternative: Finite m×n matrices with m n ≤ N_max from S_observable
Evidence: Data matrices have finite dimensions in practice

Name: Poisson Point Process
Unbounded_Assumptions: Continuous intensity λ(t); unbounded time and count
Current_Usage: Spatial processes; queuing; neuron firing
Bounded_Alternative: Discrete intensity; bounded time interval [0 T_max]; finite count
Evidence: Time bounded by observation window; intensity quantized by Planck time
